answer.c_explanation: <fuzzy>Nouns are not affected by any grammatical tone changes when placed at the very end of the sentence, before à or before ânò.

explanation.rules:
Word order: 
- S₁ wei ga S₂ V O à
in questions: S₂ V O à
in answers: S₁ wei ga S₂ V O
(S = subject; V = verb; O = object) 
- N A D (N = noun; A = adjective; D = demonstrative adjective)

Choice of pronoun (S₂): 
S₁ = S₂ => S₂ = òkì; S₁ ≠ S₂ => S₂ = o

Vowel lowering: (W with the heavy mark “.” = word with lowered vowels; W = word without lowered vowels)
... o W with “.” ... > ... ọ W with “.” ...
... o W ... > ... o W ...
... W with “.” âno ... > ... W with “.” ậno ...
... W âno ... > ... W âno ...
Tone changes: (] = word boundary; A = adjective; V is a vowel; C is a consonant) 
•        caused by adjectives: ... V] A > ... V́] A
•        caused by verb forms: 
o        affirmative form, past: ... V̀] [CV(C)VCV]verb
o        affirmative form, future: ... V] [CV́(C)VC V̀]verb
o        negative form: ... V́] [CV(C)VCV]verb
Note: The superscript "1" appears after "negative form".
